DataElement.preferredDefinition: The classification of a new lesion based upon a common qualities based on Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (iRECIST) criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the appearance of a new lesion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: New; having no previous example or precedent or parallel.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Appearance; the outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.

Concepts.definition: The outward or visible aspect of a person or thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: NCISTD: NCI CRF Harmonization and Standards Initiative
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/30/17 jk transferred context and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used._The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.: The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Concepts.definition: Preceding all others in time or space or degree.
The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.: The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

Concepts.definition: Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.
The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors New Lesion Identification Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
The identification of a lesion which has not been previously seen or characterized.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: iRECIST
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have any new malignant lesions been identified since baseline (i.e. in a previous or current reporting period)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient develop new lesions that are measurable since Baseline evaluation?
